data.title: RSC News

data.text:
CSEF Applications

The CSEF (Camps Sports and Excursions Fund) applications are now being processed for 2021. If you have already applied at the College last year, it will automatically be done for you. You do no need to do anything, no further action is required.

If you are now an eligible Centrelink Health Care Card holder and/or new to the College and have not completed the application, please do so and return to the College before Monday 15th March 2021.

Linda Wheeler

Administration

“Who Needs a Pool Anyway”

The alternative event to the Swim Carnival

will take place on the school oval on March the 9th. All year levels will be involved but will be staggered throughout the day

We encourage students to dress up and wear their house colours on the day.

Roi Boutsikakis

Director of Sports

RSC Heritage and Alumni Group

I am pleased to announce that we started this year with a new member. This is significant as we have some members thinking about leaving the committee after serving for many years, so we need more new members, people who attended either RHS or RSC who would like to help maintain the long history of the college so it can continue to be recorded.

There are people out there now who know of others who attended this school during the past 50 years who would like to help continue the work that has already been done. What we need now are people with an interest in their school/college and have some free time to attend just eight meetings in the school year. These meetings are on Monday evenings on the 3rd and 10th weeks of each term.

We offer some services to the college, such as trial interviews, support the teachers where we can, as we did with 2019 Expo for students, manage a scholarship fund for students doing VCE and more recently, help the college to convert the old paper documents and photographs to a new digital format where they will be made available to all people visiting the college website.

That work was interrupted by the Coronavirus pandemic in 2020, but we expect to have it completed in this school year.

At the end of each decade this committee has created a way to celebrate and record the times and events of Culture and Service at this college, and currently we are looking at what we can do for the 70th Anniversary in 2024.

Many of you would have attended one of these functions in the past, not thinking about how they came to fruition. Have you ever wondered about where those bollards came from, that record the six decades to 2013? It has been the people on this committee with some help from others. You can be part of helping with the next celebrations in 2024 by becoming a member of the RSC Heritage and Alumni Group.

Contact the college for details on how to get involved with your college on 9870 2002.

Barry Ring

Convenor

Ringwood Secondary College’s alumni (former students) program

Ringwood Secondary College is starting an alumni program to build and mobilise the school’s alumni community, with the help of Ourschool.

Ourschool is a not-for profit service that helps public high schools build a thriving alumni network to benefit current students and the school community.

Alumni programs in private schools and universities are well established and provide huge benefits to students. Our alumni program will help us grow our alumni community to benefit our students.

The alumni program will focus on doing these key things:

Find and connect with alumni

Invite alumni back to school to inspire students about study and career pathways

Create opportunities for students via alumni providing work experience placements

Invite alumni to provide philanthropic support for students and our school by contributing to school fund-raising projects, student scholarships or gifts in wills (longer term goals)

If you’re reading this and you’re a former student of Ringwood Secondary College, we would love to hear from you. Please get in touch with us by sending an email to:

Sylvia Tandberg

alumni@ringwoodsc.vic.edu.au

Stay tuned for more alumni news in the school’s newsletter, Facebook page and website. To learn more about Ourschool, go to www.ourschool.net.au

https://www.facebook.com/RingwoodSecondaryCollegeAlumni/

Sylvia Tandberg

Alumni Program

Annual Car Show

We have our annual car show coming up next Friday the 12th of March 6pm - 8pm to raise money for our Chaplaincy programs.

Please share this flyer attached with students, friends and family and invite anyone with a nice car that might be interested in displaying their vehicle.

Thank-you for your support

Adam Bryant

Chaplain

International Women's Day

International Women's Day celebrates the contribution women make to workplaces, families and communities and is always a great opportunity to get a group of friends or family members together, in a positive, supportive and celebratory environment. Kylie Spears, the Maroondah City Council Mayor, hosted the event on Thursday March 4th, kindly inviting to our Year 12 Prefects to participate in this celebratory breakfast.

Students: Lucy Philp, Emile Young, Hser Eh Blew Say
